commits.message:
IAM authentication and context update - EUCA-10449

Authentication and the context are updated to support use of an identity
service rather than using the existing auth API. Support for signature
v1 is removed.

X.509 certificate login is updated to locate the principal using the
certificate identifier, which is derived from the X.509 certificate.

The new UserPrincipal interface represents the authenticated principal,
which may be via a role as reflected by the authenticatedId property. A
EuareUser interface is added which has IAM specific functionality and
the existing User interface now exposes only the common ( UserPrincipal,
EuareUser ) functionality.

The UserPrincipal exposes the policies to use for authorization with the
authenticated identity and the Context is updated to provide the account
alias and number as properties.

Direct usage of Account for properties such as the alias or the
canonical identifier is removed and relaced with lookups via the
Accounts facade.

Requests using the administrator of an account now simply use the
account number (via AccountFullName), resolving the account to a user is
performed by the recipient.

An initial IdentityProvider interface is added which is the federatable
alternative to the AccountProvider interface. A DatabaseIdentityProvider
implementation is added for local identities and these providers are now
looked up via service loaders.
